arm_group.description: The 71 eyes of 64 patients (14 men and 50 women) with myopic traction maculopathy in highly myopic eyes (refractive errors ≤-8.0 diopters and axial length ≥26.0 mm) who underwent vitrectomy were retrospectively reviewed.

brief_summary.textblock:
Surgical outcome of vitrectomy for myopic traction maculopathy in highly myopic eyes was
      evaluated in each stage. Efficacy of internal limiting membrane was also evaluated whether
      it may improve visual outcome.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surgical Outcome of Vitrectomy for Myopic Traction Maculopathy in Highly Myopic Eyes

detailed_description.textblock:
Surgical outcome of vitrectomy for myopic traction maculopathy in highly myopic eyes was
      evaluated in each stage of macular retinischisis, foveal detachment, or macular hole.
      Efficacy of internal limiting membrane was also evaluated whether it may improve visual
      outcome.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Eyes with myopic traction maculopathy in highly myopic eyes with refractive errors ≤
             -8.0 diopters and axial length ≥ 26.0 mm who underwent vitrectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Eyes with follow-up less than a year

intervention.other_name: Myopic traction maculopathy in highly myopic eyes

clinical_study.official_title: Surgical Outcome of Vitrectomy for Myopic Traction Maculopathy in Highly Myopic Eyes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Anatomical retinal images by optical cohernce tomography

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
